Operation 'GetExportRecipient' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, not_actionable, poor_ai_interpretability. data.current_description:
**This endpoint can be used to check the status of a recipient export job**. 

To use this call, you will need the `id` from the "Export Recipients" call.

If you would like to download a list, take the `id` that is returned from the "Export Recipients" endpoint and make an API request here to get the `urls`. Once you have the list of URLs, make a `GET` request on each URL to download your CSV file(s).

Twilio SendGrid recommends exporting your recipients regularly as a backup to avoid issues or lost data.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve recipient export job status and download URLs
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the status and results of a recipient export job. Requires the export job ID returned from the "Export Recipients" endpoint. Returns the export job status, completion state, and download URLs for the exported CSV file(s). Once the export job completes, use the returned URLs to download the recipient data. This operation is useful for monitoring long-running export operations and retrieving exported contact lists.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Export Recipients Status' is vague and doesn't indicate the retrieval action or mention download URLs. Description is procedural and scattered, making it difficult for AI agents to understand the operation's purpose and expected behavior. Improved summary uses action verbs and clarifies dual purpose (status + URLs). Enhanced description specifies: required input (export job ID), expected outputs (status, URLs), operation purpose, and use cases for AI agent decision-making. Terminology aligned with API context (export job, recipient data, CSV).

message: Operation 'AddRecipient' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original summary 'Add recipients' is too generic. Description lacks clarity on input format (array requirement), output details (what 201 response contains), and side effects (contacts added to database). Added specifics about array format, rate limits, custom field support, and return value for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to add a Marketing Campaigns recipient.**

You can add custom field data as a parameter on this endpoint. We have provided an example using some of the default custom fields SendGrid provides.

The rate limit is three requests every 2 seconds. You can upload 1000  contacts per request. So the maximum upload rate is 1500 recipients per second.
data.summary_suggestion: Add one or more recipients to contact database
data.description_suggestion: Adds one or more recipients to your Marketing Campaigns contact database. Accepts an array of recipient objects with email addresses and optional custom field data. Supports up to 1000 contacts per request with a rate limit of 3 requests per 2 seconds (maximum 1500 recipients/second). Returns a 201 response with details of created recipients. Custom fields can be included in recipient objects using SendGrid's default or custom field definitions.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Add recipients' is too generic. Description lacks clarity on input format (array requirement), output details (what 201 response contains), and side effects (contacts added to database). Added specifics about array format, rate limits, custom field support, and return value for better AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'UpdateRecipient' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original summary lacks action clarity. Description missing output details (what 201 response contains), side effects (which fields are updated, partial vs full updates), and confirmation of partial update support. data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to update one or more recipients.**

The body of an API call to this endpoint must include an array of one or more recipient objects.

It is of note that you can add custom field data as parameters on recipient objects. We have provided an example using some of the default custom fields SendGrid provides.
data.summary_suggestion: Update one or more recipient records
data.description_suggestion: Updates one or more existing recipients in your contact database. Requires an array of recipient objects with IDs and fields to update. Supports updating email addresses, custom field data, and other recipient attributes. Returns a 201 response confirming the update. Partial updates are supported - only provided fields will be modified. Custom fields can be included using SendGrid's default or custom field definitions.
data.reasoning: Original summary lacks action clarity. Description missing output details (what 201 response contains), side effects (which fields are updated, partial vs full updates), and confirmation of partial update support. Enhanced to clarify array requirement, update scope, return value, and partial update capability for AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to deletes one or more recipients.**

The body of an API call to this endpoint must include an array of recipient IDs of the recipients you want to delete.
data.summary_suggestion: Delete multiple recipients from contact database
data.description_suggestion: Permanently deletes one or more recipients from your contact database. Requires an array of recipient IDs to delete. Removes deleted recipients from all contact lists and segments. Returns a 200 response confirming deletion. This action is irreversible and affects all associated list memberships and segment assignments.
data.reasoning: Original summary lacks specificity about batch operation. Description has grammatical error ('deletes' should be 'delete'), missing output details (what 200 response contains), and missing critical side effects (removal from lists/segments, irreversibility). Enhanced to clarify batch operation, input format, side effects, and permanent nature for AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'ListRecipient' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_context. Original summary too generic. Description lacks clarity on pagination support (3 parameters mentioned but not explained), output details (what 200 response contains), and context about when/why to use this operation. data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve all of your Marketing Campaigns recipients.**

Batch deletion of a page makes it possible to receive an empty page of recipients before reaching the end of
the list of recipients. To avoid this issue; iterate over pages until a 404 is retrieved.
data.summary_suggestion: List all recipients with pagination support
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of all recipients in your Marketing Campaigns contact database. Supports pagination parameters to control page size and offset. Returns a 200 response containing recipient records and pagination metadata. Note: Batch deletions may result in empty pages during iteration; continue paginating until a 404 response is received to ensure all recipients are retrieved. Useful for auditing contacts or exporting recipient data.
data.reasoning: Original summary too generic. Description lacks clarity on pagination support (3 parameters mentioned but not explained), output details (what 200 response contains), and context about when/why to use this operation. Added pagination explanation, output structure, and practical guidance about handling empty pages for AI agent usability.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to delete a single recipient with the given ID from your contact database.**

> Use this to permanently delete your recipients from all of your contact lists and all segments if required by applicable law.
data.description_suggestion: Permanently deletes a single recipient from your contact database by ID. Removes the recipient from all contact lists and segments. Returns a 200 response confirming deletion. This action is irreversible and cannot be undone. Use this operation when you need to comply with data deletion requests or remove individual contacts from your database.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and action-oriented. Description mentions permanent deletion and legal compliance context but lacks explicit output details (200 response confirmation) and clarity about irreversibility. Useful for understanding a recipient's list memberships or verifying list assignments.

data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to update a segment.**
data.description_suggestion: Updates an existing segment's properties such as name and filtering conditions. Accepts a segment ID and request body with updated segment details. Returns the updated segment object. Changes to segment conditions will affect which recipients are included in the segment.
data.reasoning: Original description lacks specificity about what can be updated, what inputs are required, what is returned, and what side effects occur. Enhanced version clarifies updateable fields, parameters, response, and the impact of condition changes on segment membership.

message: Operation 'DeleteSegment' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Current description mentions the optional contact deletion but doesn't clearly explain how to trigger it (via parameter). Added clarity about the delete_contacts parameter, return value, and the irreversible nature of deletion to help AI agents understand the operation's full scope and consequences.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to delete a segment from your recipients database.**

You also have the option to delete all the contacts from your Marketing Campaigns recipient database who were in this segment.
data.description_suggestion: Deletes a segment from your Marketing Campaigns contacts database. Requires the segment ID. Optionally deletes all contacts that were members of the segment by setting the `delete_contacts` parameter to true. Returns a success response. This operation cannot be undone.
data.reasoning: Current description mentions the optional contact deletion but doesn't clearly explain how to trigger it (via parameter). Added clarity about the delete_contacts parameter, return value, and the irreversible nature of deletion to help AI agents understand the operation's full scope and consequences.

message: Operation 'ListRecipientForSegment' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_output_details. Original description doesn't mention pagination support or what recipient data is returned. Enhanced version clarifies pagination parameters and response structure to help AI agents understand how to retrieve large recipient lists and what data will be available.

data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to retrieve all of the recipients in a segment with the given ID.**
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves all recipients that are members of a specified segment. Requires the segment ID. Supports pagination via limit and offset parameters. Returns an array of recipient objects containing contact information and custom field values for each member of the segment.
data.reasoning: Original description doesn't mention pagination support or what recipient data is returned. Enhanced version clarifies pagination parameters and response structure to help AI agents understand how to retrieve large recipient lists and what data will be available.

message: Operation 'ListStatus' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_context. Summary is unclear about what 'upload' refers to - clarified it's about checking job status. Description lacks context about what upload ID is needed and what status information is returned. Enhanced version clarifies the operation monitors bulk import jobs and specifies the response includes processing state and error details.

data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to check the upload status of a Marketing Campaigns recipient.**
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the status of a recipient upload job. Requires an upload ID parameter. Returns status information including the current processing state, number of records processed, and any errors encountered during the upload. Use this endpoint to monitor bulk recipient import operations.
data.reasoning: Summary is unclear about what 'upload' refers to - clarified it's about checking job status. Description lacks context about what upload ID is needed and what status information is returned. Enhanced version clarifies the operation monitors bulk import jobs and specifies the response includes processing state and error details.

data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to retrieve the total number of Marketing Campaigns recipients.**
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the total count of all Marketing Campaigns recipients in your account. This returns the total number of contacts across all lists and segments. Use this to monitor your overall contact database size. Returns a count object with the total recipient count.
data.reasoning: Original description is too brief and lacks context about what 'total' means (across all lists/segments). Added clarification about scope, use case, and return value format to improve AI agent interpretability. Summary improved for conciseness.

message: Operation 'ListSearchRecipient' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Original summary 'Search recipients' is too generic. Description is overly technical and lacks clarity about what the operation returns and when to use it versus POST search. Improved summary to be more specific, reorganized description for clarity, and added context about return value and use case differentiation.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to perform a search on all of your Marketing Campaigns recipients.**

field_name:

* is a variable that is substituted for your actual custom field name from your recipient.
* Text fields must be url-encoded. Date fields are searchable only by unix timestamp (e.g. 2/2/2015 becomes 1422835200)
* If field_name is a 'reserved' date field, such as created_at or updated_at, the system will internally convert
your epoch time to a date range encompassing the entire day. For example, an epoch time of 1422835600 converts to
Mon, 02 Feb 2015 00:06:40 GMT, but internally the system will search from Mon, 02 Feb 2015 00:00:00 GMT through
Mon, 02 Feb 2015 23:59:59 GMT.
data.description_suggestion: Searches Marketing Campaigns recipients using query parameters. Accepts a field_name parameter (custom or reserved field) and a value to search for. Text fields must be URL-encoded; date fields use unix timestamps. Reserved date fields (created_at, updated_at) automatically expand timestamps to full-day ranges. Returns matching recipient records. This is a simpler alternative to POST search when using basic field queries.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Search recipients' is too generic. Description is overly technical and lacks clarity about what the operation returns and when to use it versus POST search. Improved summary to be more specific, reorganized description for clarity, and added context about return value and use case differentiation.

message: Operation 'SearchRecipient' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, poor_ai_interpretability. Original summary is identical to GET operation, causing confusion. Description is overly detailed and poorly organized, making it hard for AI agents to understand the core purpose and when to use this versus GET search. Improved summary to differentiate from GET operation. Reorganized description to lead with purpose, then explain inputs, then outputs, then differentiation. Added clarity about return value and use case guidance.

data.current_description:
Search using segment conditions without actually creating a segment.
Body contains a JSON object with `conditions`, a list of conditions as described below, and an optional `list_id`, which is a valid list ID for a list to limit the search on.

Valid operators for create and update depend on the type of the field for which you are searching.

- Dates:
  - `"eq"`, `"ne"`, `"lt"` (before), `"gt"` (after)
    - You may use MM/DD/YYYY for day granularity or an epoch for second granularity.
  - `"empty"`, `"not_empty"`
  - `"is within"`
    - You may use an [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) date format or the # of days.
- Text: `"contains"`, `"eq"` (is - matches the full field), `"ne"` (is not - matches any field where the entire field is not the condition value), `"empty"`, `"not_empty"`
- Numbers: `"eq"`, `"lt"`, `"gt"`, `"empty"`, `"not_empty"`
- Email Clicks and Opens: `"eq"` (opened), `"ne"` (not opened)

Field values must all be a string.

Search conditions using `"eq"` or `"ne"` for email clicks and opens should provide a "field" of either `clicks.campaign_identifier` or `opens.campaign_identifier`.

The condition value should be a string containing the id of a completed campaign.

Search conditions list may contain multiple conditions, joined by an `"and"` or `"or"` in the `"and_or"` field.

The first condition in the conditions list must have an empty `"and_or"`, and subsequent conditions must all specify an `"and_or"`.
data.summary_suggestion: Search recipients using advanced segment conditions
data.description_suggestion: Searches Marketing Campaigns recipients using complex segment conditions without creating a persistent segment. Request body must contain a `conditions` array with filter criteria and optional `list_id` to scope search to a specific list. Supports multiple conditions joined with AND/OR logic. Operators vary by field type: dates support eq/ne/lt/gt/empty/not_empty/is_within; text supports contains/eq/ne/empty/not_empty; numbers support eq/lt/gt/empty/not_empty; email engagement supports eq/ne for campaign opens/clicks. All field values must be strings. Returns matching recipient records. Use this for complex multi-condition searches; use GET /search for simple single-field queries.
data.reasoning: Original summary is identical to GET operation, causing confusion. Description is overly detailed and poorly organized, making it hard for AI agents to understand the core purpose and when to use this versus GET search. Improved summary to differentiate from GET operation. Reorganized description to lead with purpose, then explain inputs, then outputs, then differentiation. Added clarity about return value and use case guidance.

message: Operation 'CreateSegment' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Summary is adequate but description is problematic: it starts with vague 'allows you to create' language, then jumps into operator details without explaining what inputs are required or what the operation returns. Missing information about side effects (segment becomes available for use). Reorganized description to lead with purpose and required inputs, then explain operator details, then specify return value and side effects for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to create a new segment.**


  Valid operators for create and update depend on the type of the field for which you are searching.

**Dates**
- "eq", "ne", "lt" (before), "gt" (after)
    - You may use MM/DD/YYYY for day granularity or an epoch for second granularity.
- "empty", "not_empty"
- "is within"
    - You may use an [ISO 8601 date format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) or the # of days.

**Text**
- "contains"
- "eq" (is/equals - matches the full field)
- "ne" (is not/not equals - matches any field where the entire field is not the condition value)
- "empty"
- "not_empty"

**Numbers**
- "eq" (is/equals)
- "lt" (is less than)
- "gt" (is greater than)
- "empty"
- "not_empty"

**Email Clicks and Opens**
- "eq" (opened)
- "ne" (not opened)

All field values must be a string.


Conditions using "eq" or "ne" for email clicks and opens should provide a "field" of either `clicks.campaign_identifier` or `opens.campaign_identifier`.
The condition value should be a string containing the id of a completed campaign.


The conditions list may contain multiple conditions, joined by an "and" or "or" in the "and_or" field.

The first condition in the conditions list must have an empty `"and_or"`, and subsequent conditions must all specify an `"and_or"`.
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new segment based on specified conditions. Request body must contain a segment name and a `conditions` array defining the segment criteria. Supports multiple conditions joined with AND/OR logic. Operators vary by field type: dates support eq/ne/lt/gt/empty/not_empty/is_within; text supports contains/eq/ne/empty/not_empty; numbers support eq/lt/gt/empty/not_empty; email engagement supports eq/ne for campaign opens/clicks. All field values must be strings. The first condition must have an empty `and_or` field; subsequent conditions must specify AND or OR. Returns the created segment object with segment ID, name, conditions, and recipient count. The segment is immediately available for use in campaigns and recipient management.
data.reasoning: Summary is adequate but description is problematic: it starts with vague 'allows you to create' language, then jumps into operator details without explaining what inputs are required or what the operation returns. Missing information about side effects (segment becomes available for use). Reorganized description to lead with purpose and required inputs, then explain operator details, then specify return value and side effects for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to retrieve all of your segments.**
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves all segments in your Marketing Campaigns account. Returns a list of segment objects, each containing the segment ID, name, conditions, and current recipient count. Use this to view all available segments for targeting, analysis, or management purposes.
